Reviews.Content: Economical and clean Albergo Losanna was perfect for our three nights in Florence last August. We paid 45 euros a night and got a clean room, a friendly hotelier and a decent location. We were able to walk to everything in Florence with the exception of the train station when we were toting our luggage. The lack of air conditioning was not an issue although it was hot. The common showers were clean and always available in the mornings and at night. The best thing about this hotel though was the woman who worked the front desk. She was nice and very patient with my boyfriend and I who spoke very poor to no Italian. She was up every morning cooking us breakfast -- which consisted of coffee or tea and stale bread. Like most of the places we stayed, they asked us to pay cash but we were forewarned and had plenty.I would recommend this hotel to a no-frills economy traveler.
Reviews.Author: Megotron

Reviews.Content: Good place, reasonable price This place is reasonably priced, and within walking distance of most of the attractions in Florence. Rooms are very basic but clean. The place is a bit old, but that added to the charm of the stay. The hostess was very nice and helpful. She speaks very little English, but tried her best. We were in Italy, after all!
Reviews.Author: AinsleyQ

Reviews.Content: Good location and price, but definitely bare bones The clean but Spartan Losanna is a fairly priced and well located option, but has a few limitations (minimal breakfast, no window screens). I booked the Losanna through the 365 bookings office at the Florence train station on the basis of its low price: 鈧?6 for a single room.The positives were the room's cleanliness, the kindness of the hostess, and the location: 15-20 minutes' walk from Santa Maria Novella and 10 minutes from Campo di Marte train stations. It is at number 9 on Via V. Alfieri in a quiet neighborhood.The room and bed linens were spotless. The shower in the shared toilet was good. The bare floors and walls make for echoes; however, having only 9 guest rooms, the Losanna does not see a lot of coming and going.The negatives were the very minimal breakfast (tea/coffee, a bread roll and jam) and the absence of window screens, a key consideration in the summer months if you must have a window open. (No air conditioning, as should be expected with most European budget hotels.)The hostess was kind. She speaks very little English, however. I understand slowly spoken Italian well (and told her so, in Italian), but when I asked her to speak slowly, she instead tried her English, which was frustrating for both of us.Although she was very gracious in offering to hold my bags for the day after I had checked out, she did rush me a bit to leave that morning (before the stated 10 a.m. check-out time). I think she thought that I was going to walk away with her room key!
Reviews.Author: ValueValueValue

Reviews.Content: Good once you know it. I stay there twice a year and have stayed there several times, but have not had any out the ordinary experiences, I made sure I had mosquito spray, before arriving, even in the heat of summer, all that was needed was a fan. OK, and one of those plug in deterents. So the lady doesnt speak much inglais? we were in Firenze, isnt that to be expected? I only wish that I spoke more Italiano. I would go back for the experience of Florence again!signed.A Traveller, London, UK
Reviews.Author: HugsterLondon

Reviews.Content: Charming at first... but avoid We stayed in a one bedroom this past summer. The hostess was nice enough but spoke very little English and could not manage to give us directions, and we ended paying for a taxi to get us there even though it was within walking distance. The location is central and within walking distance to most attractions. The accomodations were clean. However there is no air conditioning, no fans, and no window screens. So be prepared for plenty of mosquitoes! We complained to the hostess asking for a fan but she said she had none. The breakfast was basically one piece of toast and coffee/tea/juice. Overall for the price, it was definitely not worth it, and I would not go back simply because of the horrible experience with the mosquitoes.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
